data.title: Andrea Bocelli and other Christian artists release new film in time for Easter
data.meta_description: The well-known and gifted Italian Tenor Andrea Bocelli is releasing The Journey: A Music Special with other powerhouse Christian vocalists. Joining Bocelli in the film are artists such as Michael W. Smith, Tauren Wells, Tori Kelly, and TAYA from Hillsong UNITED.  The film will be in exclusive theatres from April 2-6, 2023.   Gearing up for the release, TAYA sang 'Oceans' recently in Time Square in New York City. Smith joined the launch and sang on stage as well before Bocelli himself got up to sing 'Amazing Grace.'  googletag.cmd.push(function() { if($(document).width()<900) { s = googletag.defineSlot('/50748803/chv_ros_bb', [300, 250], 'div-gpt-1616015438375-bbm1'); s.setTargeting('URL', [window.location.pathname]); s.setTargeting('position', [1616015438375]) s.addService(googletag.pubads()); googletag.pubads().refresh([s], {changeCorrelator: false}); } });
data.text:
The well-known and gifted Italian Tenor Andrea Bocelli is releasing The Journey: A Music Special with other powerhouse Christian vocalists.

Joining Bocelli in the film are artists such as Michael W. Smith, Tauren Wells, Tori Kelly, and TAYA from Hillsong UNITED.

The film will be in exclusive theatres from April 2-6, 2023.

Gearing up for the release, TAYA sang 'Oceans' recently in Time Square in New York City. Smith joined the launch and sang on stage as well before Bocelli himself got up to sing 'Amazing Grace.'

"I’ve sung this song more times than I could count but getting to sing ‘Oceans,’ in the middle of Times Square to open up the premiere of ‘The Journey,’ a movie that has changed my life getting to be apart of (literally) was truly all an honour," says TAYA on Facebook.

After hitting theatres the film will be able to be viewed on Trinity Broadcast Network (TBN).

"So grateful for the opportunity to spend time with my friend Andrea Bocelli last night in Times Square, celebrating the premiere of THE JOURNEY," says Smith. "I hope you take the chance to experience this film for yourself. It’s pretty amazing."

According to the movie's release, "Bocelli and his wife Veronica travel on horseback along Italy’s Via Francigena, an ancient road traveled by pilgrims for centuries in the footsteps of the apostles and saints."

The whole film starts off with an introduction and welcome from the Pope. Bocelli's children and wife also make an appearance in the film.
